subject: statistics
title: Bayesian Linear Regression
contentHtml: Bayesian linear regression is a powerful tool for modeling and predicting continuous outcomes based on multiple predictor variables.

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves applying Bayes' theorem to the prior distribution of the coefficients and the likelihood function of the data.

intuition: This theorem shows how to update our beliefs about the coefficients given new data. It's a fundamental concept in Bayesian linear regression.
realWorldApplications: Predicting stock prices based on economic indicators

subject: statistics
title: Bayesian Linear Regression Theorem
contentHtml: The Bayesian linear regression theorem provides a framework for modeling and analyzing linear relationships between variables while incorporating prior knowledge.

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the posterior distribution of \beta is a normal distribution with mean and variance updated based on the prior and data.

intuition: This theorem provides a way to incorporate prior knowledge about the coefficients in a linear regression model, allowing for more informed predictions and decision-making.
realWorldApplications: Predicting stock prices using historical data
